qas.question: When was the offices of restored to the Witness congregations?
Starting in September 2014, who was responsible for making appointments in the Church?
In 1976 whose power in Watch Tower Society was diminished?
Who has been president of the Society since 2000?
In what year did branch committees start to make appointments?
Who was one of the members of the Governing Body in 1977?
Who was one of the members of the Governing Body in 1995?

context: The offices of elder and ministerial servant were restored to Witness congregations in <a0_0><b5_0>1972<b5_0/><a0_0/>, with appointments made from headquarters (and later, also by branch committees). It was announced that, starting in September 2014, appointments would be made by <a1_0>traveling overseers<a1_0/>. In a major organizational overhaul in 1976, the power of the Watch Tower Society <a2_0>president<a2_0/> was diminished, with authority for doctrinal and organizational decisions passed to the Governing Body. Since Knorr's death in <a3_0>1977<a3_0/>, the position of president has been occupied by Frederick Franz (1977–1992) and Milton Henschel (1992–2000), both members of the Governing Body, and since 2000 by <a4_0><b6_0><b7_0>Don A. Adams<b7_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/>, not a member of the Governing Body. In 1995, Jehovah's Witnesses abandoned the idea that Armageddon must occur during the lives of the generation that was alive in 1914 and in 2013 changed their teaching on the "generation".
